STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
May 19, 2023
Tina Lynn Smigelski
ALPENA/MONTMORENCY DHHS
711 W CHISHOLM ST,
ALPENA, MI, 49707-2428
RE: License#: CP040200941
Dear Tina Lynn Smigelski:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 05/18/2023 . The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5060.
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
• None
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• None
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.

There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. The
agency had a corrective action plan for the interim evaluation completed 8/4/2022.
Areas identified in noncompliance as a part of that interim evaluation were 324(8),
327(5)(d), (6)(a)(b)(c), (7), 405(4), 413(1)(c)(ii), 418(2)(b), 422(3)(e), 509(3),
504(2), 505(2)(a), 510, MISEP 4.22, FOM 722-6(B), and FOM 801-03. The
Corrective Action Plan was submitted 9/2/2022 and approved 9/19/2022. There
was no repeat noncompliance as a part of this renewal evaluation.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment included a review of the progress of the
agency in completing the Corrective Action Plan that was submitted and approved
for the interim evaluation completed 8/4/2022. The assessment also included a
review of the Key Performance Indicators by the agency.
Financial Overview
N/A
Staff and Youth Interviews
Child Welfare Staff were involved in both the entrance conference and exit
conference. Staff comments were positive, and no concerns were noted.
Youth interviews with the analyst were generally positive with no concerns
identified.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency has adequate space to meet the service needs of children and
families. Record storage is consistent with rules compliance.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no safety alerts. Youth and caregiver comments were generally positive
and indicated agency is providing a reasonable amount of support.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.

05/19/2023

Mark Hunter Date
